description:
Summary:

Users interact with the multitouch joystick to specify an angle and amplitude.  These values can be used to control other objects in the scene such as movement and which direction to shoot.  Can be used to make twin-stick shooter games.

How to use:

- Add this behavior to a sprite that will be the joystick 
- Place the joystick object on the scene
- Run the "Activate joystick" action on every frame and specify the thumb object
- The joystick thumb object will automatically be created and moved

Tips:

- Thumb object must be smaller than the joystick object
- More than one joystick can be used at the same time
- Joystick and thumb objects should be squares (all sides the same length)
name: MultitouchJoystick
shortDescription: Activate a joystick that can be controlled by interacting with a touchscreen.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate a joystick that can be controlled by interacting with a touchscreen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MultitouchJoystick

eventsFunctions.name: ActivateJoystick
eventsFunctions.sentence: Activate joystick _PARAM0_ using _PARAM2_ as the thumbstick

events.comment: Create joystick thumb and link it to the joystick
Start with thumb in the center (acts like a spring on a real controller)
Move joystick thumb to the location of the touch
Move thumb back inside radius (if needed)

events.name: Update joystick values based on position

events.comment: Calculate the percent of distance the thumb has moved from the center of joystick.

eventsFunctions.description: Percent amount the thumb has been pulled away from the joystick center (Range: 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: JoystickAmplitude

eventsFunctions.description: Angle the joystick is pointing towards (Range: -180 to 180).
eventsFunctions.name: JoystickAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if joystick amplitude is greater or equal to a value.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckJoystickAmplitude
eventsFunctions.sentence: Amplitude of _PARAM0_ is  greater or equal to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if joystick is pushed in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: DirectionPushed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a joystick is pressed.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Move thumb of joystick to match a given angle and amplitude.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveThumb
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move thumb _PARAM2_ of joystick _PARAM0_ to angle _PARAM3_ and amplitude _PARAM4_

events.comment: Move thumb object to correct position
Mark joystick as pressed (not implemented yet)
